ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic match with mesomelia, brachydactyly, triangular mouth, hypertelorism, short nose, anteverted nares, frontal bossing, micropenis, and short stature - all cardinal features of Robinow syndrome.
Autosomal dominant form of Robinow syndrome with similar features but typically milder presentation. The severe micropenis and mesomelia suggest the recessive form may be more likely.
Features brachydactyly and mesomelia as key components, along with facial dysmorphism. However, lacks specific mention of triangular mouth and micropenis which are prominent in this case.
Shows mesomelia and severe brachydactyly with short stature, but lacks the characteristic facial features and genital abnormalities seen in this patient.
Features hypertelorism, anteverted nares, long philtrum, brachydactyly, joint hypermobility, and genital abnormalities, but lacks mesomelia and triangular mouth which are prominent here.
Shows hypertelorism, short nose, and short stature with possible genital abnormalities, but lacks the specific skeletal features like mesomelia and symphalangism seen in this case.
